# prepareToPlay()

**Instance Method**

Prepares a media player for playback.

## Declaration

```swift
func prepareToPlay()
```

## Discussion

If a media player isn’t already prepared to play when you call the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPMediaPlayback/play()] method, that method automatically calls this method. However, to minimize playback delay, call this method before you call [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPMediaPlayback/play()].

Calling this method may interrupt the media player’s audio session. For information on interruptions and how to respond to them, see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Audio/Conceptual/AudioSessionProgrammingGuide/Introduction/Introduction.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40007875].

## Starting and stopping playback

- **play()**: Initiates playback of the current item.
- **pause()**: Pauses playback of the current item.
- **stop()**: Ends playback of the current item.
- **isPreparedToPlay**: A Boolean value indicating whether a media player is ready to play.
